review_title: SFU might be all right for staff, but faculty beware
pros: Saint Francis employs a lot of wonderful people who care deeply about the students. Doesn't pay much, but it's got a pleasant campus, and many employees take advantage of the free tuition for themselves and their children.
cons:
On the academic side, conditions have been spiraling downward. Faculty governance has been ignored; the tenure clock was arbitrarily stopped for a year; department chairs were stripped of their duties (against faculty handbook regulations) so that the administration could put more compliant people in place....

And 15-20 faculty were terminated (including a few with tenure!) because of "financial exigency," yet the president boasted to the student newspaper, Troubadour, about $2 million of "found money" (via refinancing debt) that is going to be used to remodel part of the student center into a food court. 

To be sure, money IS tight, because of falling enrollment (which was not well-planned for, though we saw it coming ten years ago). 

The president is not a bad man, but somebody’s been giving him terrible advice. Several of our best professors who survived the Purge have left of their own accord, and those who remain are polishing the c.v., as SFU's atmosphere is poisoned, given the newfound distrust of the administration. (The pay has always been poor, but the working conditions used to make up for that, to some degree. No more.) 

If you are desperate for a teaching job, Saint Francis University might be worth considering, but otherwise, find someplace fiscally sound that respects faculty.

pros: It is a very pretty campus
cons: They pay well below average

review_title: Failing University where you would not want to work
pros: Nice campus, mostly great people, good holiday schedule
cons: Poor leadership, mismanagement, large financial debt

pros: There are a handful of strong departments and competent administrators. They have made some investments in sorely needed new buildings and in renovating old buildings. If the right people like you then you're golden.
cons: Student evaluations of faculty are taken as gospel and you will either make them happy or you will not last long, no matter how well you are actually teaching. The administration cares first and foremost about student retention. Grade inflation is a problem everywhere, but it is a tremendous issue at SFU that no one wants to discuss. Faculty are expected to teach 12 hours per semester, with as many as 4 preps, and are still expected to do original research in their field, mentor students, be available outside of office hours any time a student desires, do tons of committee work, and do community service as well. The faculty senate is completely powerless to direct the path of the university.

review_title: experience met expectations, which were not high

Does not value employees. Deliberately and knowingly pays below median. All employees who are not professors are expected to be at work, on time, even if highways are closed due to blizzards and even if their job doesn't involve the feeding or care of students.

cons: For an institution that's sells education, they don't value it when it comes to employees. Zero professional growth programs or opportunities. Unbalanced compensation. HR dept doesn't help strategically due to being understaffed and inexperienced.

job_title: Graduate Assistant/Assistant Coach in Loretto, PA
pros: Athletics is a tightly knit group.  Despite the fact that our golf facilities (golf course) are different than the main athletics building, everyone is always welcome to see both myself and then head coach.  Always a friendly culture.
cons: Graduate Assistants are sometimes taken advantage of.  Stipend still exists which is nice but is less than other comparable Division I Universities.

review_title: I was brought in as an instructor in training. The supervisor had unreasonable expectations,

cons: The salary is low, For an office, they cram you into a small 7x6 foot room with another instructor. Low pay high hours.

review_title: Great environment, just doesn't pay well

cons: There isn't much to do in the area. You will have to travel a little ways for any major type of shopping. If you are single and looking to find someone, this is not the place to come.
